intro: Amsinckia douglasiana, commonly known as the Douglas's fiddleneck, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that resemble a fiddle. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, oblong fruits called cypsela. Amsinckia douglasiana is often found in regions with Mediterranean climates and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
